circumstances: During IFR flight at 12,000 feet both aircraft vacuum pumps failed. Aircraft descended in right turn off radar. Witnesses observed aircraft at low altitude above trees, circle, make steep left turn, climb and descend to ground. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Occurrence #1: loss of control - in flight
Phase of operation: cruise
Findings
1. (c) vacuum system - failure, total
2. (c) ifr procedure - improper - pilot in command
3. (c) flight/nav instruments, attitude gyro - inoperative
4. (c) stall - inadvertent - pilot in command
5. (f) spatial disorientation - pilot in command
----------
Occurrence #2: in flight collision with terrain/water
Phase of operation: descent - uncontrolled
